required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Lung Function and Symptoms in Patients Diagnosed With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) on Long-Acting Bronchodilator Monotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: An Evaluation of Lung Function and Symptoms in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) on Long-Acting Bronchodilator Monotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: A multicenter study to evaluate lung function and symptoms in subjects with COPD who have been on regular use of only one long-acting bronchodilator.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Whose Post-albuterol Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Was <80% Predicted Normal
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of a 1-day study; 15-30 min post-albuterol (self-administered)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants on long-acting bronchodilator (LABD) monotherapy who had a post-albuterol FEV1) <80% predicted normal was calculated. FEV1 is the amount of air that can be expelled from the lungs in one second after a full inspiration. Predicted normal values for FEV1 were calculated using the reference values from the third National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES III). Values are based on the participants' age, height, sex, and race; thus, normal values vary based on participants' demographics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Whose Post-albuterol FEV1 Was <50% Predicted Normal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of a 1-day study; 15-30 min post-albuterol (self-administered)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants on long-acting bronchodilator (LABD) monotherapy who met spirometric criteria for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and who had a post-albuterol FEV1 (the amount of air expelled from the lungs in one second after a full inspiration) <50% predicted normal was calculated. Predicted normal values for FEV1 were calculated using the reference values from the third National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES III). Values are based on the participants' age, height, sex, and race; thus, normal values vary based on participants' demographics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Categorized Post-albuterol Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second/Forced Vital Capacity (FEV1/FVC) Ratios
secondary_outcome.description: The ratio is calculated as the amount of air expelled from the lungs in one second after a full inspiration (FEV1) divided by the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out after a full inspiration (FVC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Modified Medical Research Council (mMRC) Dyspnea Scale Scores for Participants With Post-albuterol FEV1 <80% and >=80%
secondary_outcome.description: The 5-point mMRC Dyspnea Scale measures the level of dyspnea (trouble breathing) experienced by participants. Scores range from 0 (none) to 4 (very severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean mMRC Dyspnea Scale Scores for Participants With Post-albuterol FEV1 <50% and >=50%
secondary_outcome.description: The 5-point mMRC Dyspnea Scale measures the level of dyspnea (trouble breathing) experienced by participants. Scores range from 0 (none) to 4 (very severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had a COPD Exacerbation Requiring Hospitalization With Post-albuterol FEV1 <80% and >=80%
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who had a COPD exacerbation (defined as worsening of COPD symptoms) requiring hospitalization was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had a COPD Exacerbation Requiring Hospitalization With Post-albuterol FEV1 <50% and >=50%
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who had a COPD exacerbation (defined as worsening of COPD symptoms) requiring hospitalization was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had a COPD Exacerbation Requiring Oral Corticosteroids and/or Antibiotics With Post-albuterol FEV1 <80% and >=80%
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with a COPD exacerbation (worsening of COPD symptoms) requiring treatment with oral corticosteroids and/or antibiotics was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Had a COPD Exacerbation Requiring Oral Corticosteroids and/or Antibiotics With Post-albuterol FEV1 <50% and >=50%
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with a COPD exacerbation (worsening of COPD symptoms) requiring treatment with oral corticosteroids and/or antibiotics was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Puffs From All Short-acting Bronchodilators Used in the Past Two Weeks in Participants With an FEV1 of <80% and >=80%
secondary_outcome.description: The average number of puffs from all short-acting bronchodilators used in the past 2 weeks was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Puffs From All Short-acting Bronchodilators Used in the Past Two Weeks in Participants With an FEV1 of <50% and >=50%
secondary_outcome.description: The average number of puffs from all short-acting bronchodilators used in the past 2 weeks was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reports of Diagnosis and/or Treatment for Specific Cardiovascular (Heart), Psychiatric (Anxiety or Depression), and/or Bone Disorders in the <80%, >=80%, <50%, and >=50% FEV1 Groups
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with the indicated affected medical conditions were counted.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with diagnosed COPD who are on only one long acting bronchodilator medication to control their COPD symptoms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cigarette smoking history-Current or ex-smokers (defined as stopped smoking for at least three months prior to the study visit)
- Established history of COPD as diagnosed by a physician
- Regular use (prescribed for use every day) of only one long-acting bronchodilator greater than or equal to one month before the study visit
- Ability to read, comprehend, and record information in the English language
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently active asthma (receiving asthma therapy and or having asthma symptoms)
- Use of ipratropium/albuterol combination products greater than three times per day, use of inhaled corticosteroids, use of inhaled corticosteroid/long-acting beta-agonist combinations, theophylline preparations, or oral beta agonists within 3 months prior to the study visit
- Previous lung surgery
- Other respiratory disorders other than COPD
- Current alcohol, illegal drug, or solvent abuse
- Females with a positive urine pregnancy test at the study visit

reference.citation: Dransfield MT, Bailey W, Crater G, Emmett A, O'Dell DM, Yawn B. Disease severity and symptoms among patients receiving monotherapy for COPD. Prim Care Respir J. 2011 Mar;20(1):46-53. doi: 10.4104/pcrj.2010.00059.

group.title: Participants With Diagnosed COPD
group.description: Current and previous smokers with at least a 10 pack/year history of cigarette smoking and an established history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) as diagnosed by a physician

group.description: Current and previous smokers with at least a 10 pack/year history of cigarette smoking and an established history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) as diagnosed by a physician

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.description: One participant chose more than one race category; this participant was counted twice.

class.title: American Indian or Alaska Native and White

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Whose Post-albuterol Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Was <80% Predicted Normal
outcome.description: The percentage of participants on long-acting bronchodilator (LABD) monotherapy who had a post-albuterol FEV1) <80% predicted normal was calculated. FEV1 is the amount of air that can be expelled from the lungs in one second after a full inspiration. Predicted normal values for FEV1 were calculated using the reference values from the third National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES III). Values are based on the participants' age, height, sex, and race; thus, normal values vary based on participants' demographics.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of a 1-day study; 15-30 min post-albuterol (self-administered)
outcome.population: All participants enrolled in the study who had a post-albuterol FEV1 measurement. Some participants had unacceptable post-albuterol spirometry measurements and were not included in this analysis.

group.title: Participants With Diagnosed COPD and Post-albuterol FEV1 <80%
group.description: Current and previous smokers with at least a 10 pack/year history of cigarette smoking and an established history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) as diagnosed by a physician who also had a post-albuterol FEV1 <80%

measure.title: Mean Modified Medical Research Council (mMRC) Dyspnea Scale Scores for Participants With Post-albuterol FEV1 <80% and >=80%

analysis.estimate_desc: Least squares mean differences are calculated as <80% group minus >=80% group and are adjusted for Investigator.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
